labels.name: semver-minor: tighten rules to match guide

body:
We recently had an incident where this rule would have prevented
infinite loops in Hypernova and in the browser.

title: Link to reddit/styleguide is broken
body: https://github.com/reddit/styleguide/ returns 404.

title: Include 'accumulator' exception for no-param-reassign
body: See https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1767 for explanation.

title: Include "accumulator" in exceptions to no-param-reassign
body: We love the `acc` exception to `no-param-reassign`, found [here](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/90235cab7c060d69430001cf17aa28ff74da86b4/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L175). However, we would love to also include "accumulator" as the full word carries more meaning and is more accessible for developers less familiar with JS idioms. We'd love to add this - what are your thoughts on us opening a PR with the change?

title: Feature/core 1644 eslint refactoring
body: https://mindojo.atlassian.net/browse/core-1644

title: Question regarding console log/warn/error
body: Hello, what is the practise regarding the console functions? It's strictly not allowed in production, sure. But what about pushing code with console functions to a Github repo. Is it considered fine to use them on dev and test environments?

title: How can i use airbnb-eslint in my ejected create-react-app project?
body:
I had ejected my create-react-app project and installed "eslint-config-airbnb-base"

added .editorconfig,.eslintignore,.eslintrc.js three files in root catalog

![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16483316/37410498-be0da628-27db-11e8-93d7-90a1fe343bcc.png)

![0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16483316/37411170-21d11cde-27dd-11e8-897d-4c8cc28519aa.png)

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16483316/37411255-5d81f9ce-27dd-11e8-8030-8ebd5257183d.png)

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16483316/37411283-6ede3372-27dd-11e8-8b00-b1461498cb76.png)

But it doesn't work,where goes wrong?

I guess some entries haven't been modified in somewhere?

title: Is it recommended to start a function name with is? Since it is not a typical verb
if statements are not checked for preceding newline
Update object-curly-newline to match ESLint 4.18.0
body:
In ESLint 4.18.0 separate settings are introduced for imports and exports for the object-curly-newline rule.

Without this change, there is different behaviour when updating ESLint to this version.

title: Reflect migration from mocha to jest
body:
It's my understanding that Airbnb replaced Mocha with Jest, according to this article: https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/unlocking-test-performance-migrating-from-mocha-to-jest-2796c508ec50

This PR reflects that change with a one-sentence edit.
